summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on August 12, 2019. The manager provides detailed information about MCC operations, protocols, and his interactions with Jeffrey Epstein in the days leading up to Epstein's death by suicide in his cell on August 10, 2019. The document reveals procedural gaps, including the failure to maintain a constant cellmate for Epstein as ordered.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate housed in the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU) who was found deceased in his cell on August 10, 2019. The interview details his activities, mood, and the circumstances leading to his death.

persons.name: T. Noel
persons.context: A Corrections Officer present during Epstein's phone call on August 9 and later found in a daze after Epstein's death. He reported that Epstein gave him a thumbs-up during a 10:00 p.m. stand-up count.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: A Corrections Officer who did not report to work on August 12, 2019, and for whom a welfare check was conducted.

persons.name: Wheeler
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent who witnessed the interviewee signing the OIG warnings form at the beginning of the interview.

connections.description: CO T. Noel was one of the guards present during Epstein's phone call on August 9 and later reported a thumbs-up interaction with Epstein during a count.

events.title: Epstein's Previous Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to commit suicide while housed in the SHU. A doctor ordered that he must always have a cellmate as a result, but this order was communicated verbally, not in writing.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call
events.description: Epstein made a 15-minute social phone call from the SHU shower area, facilitated by the Unit Manager. He called a number with a (347) area code and spoke to a male.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC, slumped over with a noose around his neck. His cellmate had not returned from court the previous day.

events.title: FBI Interview of Unit Manager
events.description: The Unit Manager was interviewed by FBI Special Agents and an AUSA regarding MCC operations and the events surrounding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
FBI-New York offices, 290 Broadway, New York, New York
MCC hospital on Park Row (separate from main building)
keyFacts: A doctor had verbally ordered that Jeffrey Epstein must always have a cellmate following a suicide attempt in July 2019, but this critical instruction was not provided in writing or posted in the SHU office.
On the night of his death, Epstein's cellmate had not returned from court, leaving him alone in his cell contrary to the verbal order.
The MCC's video surveillance system was not functioning properly at the time of Epstein's death, though staff operated under the assumption it was working.
The Unit Manager assisted Epstein with a social phone call on August 9, 2019, the night before his death, and described Epstein as being in a good mood.
After Epstein's death, MCC personnel used a decoy (boxes and sheets) to mislead the press and allow the medical examiner's vehicle to leave unnoticed with Epstein's body.
